york floods : live updates from public meeting over december 2015 's floods and aftermath .

documents.title: all our live coverage from the york floods public meeting
text: that 's the end of our live coverage of the york floods public meeting at the barbican .
there 'll be more reaction to what the public officials told the people of york tonight on bbc radio york 's breakfast programme from 06:00 tomorrow .
thanks for being with us and have a good night .
author: Lauren Potts
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flooding was a 'truly exceptional ' circumstance
text: the environment agency 's mark scott said even though the pumps have been `` more than adequate '' for 30 years , he is hopeful the capacity of the foss barrier can be increased to make it more resilient .
`` we can never account for nature .
this was a truly exceptional circumstance and we are doing something about it , '' he said .

documents.title: bt exchange hit by power cut which took 36 hours to repair
text: bt regional director tom keeney says the floods caused a power cut at the city 's exchange , disrupting communications .
he explained that back-up power ran out and it was difficult for engineers to to get in to make repairs .
as a result the recovery operation took them 36 hours .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: did anyone know the foss barrier might fail ?
text: the audience is raising questions about a report which warned of risks to the foss barrier .
a woman who worked for the council in 2000 told the meeting there were concerns even then that the defences could fail .

documents.title: timeline of events during christmas holiday floods
text: york city council has produced its own timeline on its flooding advice page .
it describes it as a `` high-level overview '' of events from 23 to 31 december - and as you can see below it 's very detailed :
author: Lauren Potts
BBC Local Live

documents.title: under-fire council chief tries to be heard above heckling
text: cary mcmahon , who was a volunteer during the floods clean-up , says there is a palpable anger about the council 's recovery effort .
`` the council need to get a grip , it is a disgrace .
council chief executive steve stewart replies : `` that 's your opinion '' .
he 's being heckled and adds : 'i ca n't help you if you wo n't let me answer '' .

he manages to explain that the council provided 65 skips at their own cost to help with the floods clear-up , provided a 24/7 phone line from boxing day , but is further heckled so ca n't give any more details .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: 'nobody came until 1am ' flooded resident complains
text: one lady who has lived on navigation road for 25 years says she 'd never seen anything like these floods .
at 7pm on boxing day she could see there was a problem but says no one came to her until 1am the following morning to see if she needed evacuating .
sgt phil mccain , from north yorkshire police , answers a question on `` warning and informing '' people .
he says they do n't have the resources at the click of a button and they had to go to the 600 people at immediate risk of flooding .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: environment agency at a loss over foss barrier failure
text: the environment agency says it still does n't know why the foss barrier pumping station flooded so quickly .
mark scott ( the meeting that investigations are under way to establish where the sudden rush of water came from in the pump room .
he said they raised the barrier to prevent more flooding to other homes and businesses - otherwise 1,000 properties would have flooded .
he added it was `` incredibly regrettable '' that properties flooded .
those properties which flooded would have flooded even if the barrier had n't been raised , but would have flooded more quickly .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: flooding chief executive : 'no-one died '
text: the council 's chief executive steve stewart is addressing a very frustrated audience .
he said the authority set up rest centres , visited 900 properties of people at risk and those who were elderly and infirm .
`` the first priority is to make sure no one died - and no one did , '' he told the meeting .
he acknowledged however that the message was getting through that the council needs to look at how people were kept informed .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: woman complains over delayed information to riverside residents
text: one woman says she had no idea she was going to be flooded until her husband stepped out into six inches of water .
she says there was a seven-hour gap before any official response and that annoys her .
she added ; `` you do n't spend boxing day watching the environment agency website .
`` the police knew , the environment agency knew , silver command knew at 11am , but those living along the river did n't know . ''
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: £ 10m foss barrier flood money 'not new '
text: there 's been some confusion over the announcement we reported earlier that there would be an extra £ 10m for improvements to the foss barrier .
it turns out the cash is part of the £ 40m package for yorkshire 's flood defences , which was revealed by the prime minister on 3 january .

documents.title: environment agency says sorry to christmas flood victims
text: audience members say they do n't have a problem with police and fire and rescue services , but they do have problems with the environment agency .
mike scott , from ea , acknowledges victims who have had cold , dirty flood water in their homes over christmas and says sorry .
he says they want to work with people who live here , and they do n't underestimate how tough it has been for people .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: environment agency : 'barrier was overwhelmed '
text: john knight is the flood resilience manager at the environment agency .
he spoke to bbc radio york earlier today and insists the foss barrier was overwhelmed .
`` the pumping capacity of the foss barrier is 30 cubic metres a second or 30 tonnes of water a second .
the flows that we recorded at our gauge in huntingdon showed that flows were in excess of 40 cubic metres a second , '' he said .

documents.title: a who 's who of the key officials facing the public
text: among those to be grilled by the public at tonight 's meeting are :
councillor steward told bbc radio york people needed to `` release a lot of concern and anger '' .

documents.title: york floods meeting : what you want to know
text: i 've been speaking to some of the residents as they arrive for tonight 's meeting .

john findlay , of fishergate in the centre of york , says he would like to find out via a freedom of information request what risk assessments were carried out relating to the foss barrier and records of its maintenance .

and charlie mcaleese , who runs an army supplies shop on fishergate , wants to know if the tofficials knew at 07:00 on boxing day there was a major event coming why were the sandbags not given out earlier ?
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: first opportunity to quiz officials over crucial foss barrier decision
text: this is the first time residents and business owners will come face to face with the people involved in the city 's response to devastating christmas floods .
sure to be on the agenda will be questions about the decision to raise the foss barrier amid fears the adjoining pumping station could be overwhelmed by water .

documents.title: stage set for flood meeting
text: i 've just arrived at the barbican in york ahead of the floods meeting which kicks off in less than half an hour .
the stage is set and they want your feedback .
author: Gemma Dillon
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: 'nightmare ' of york floods forced hundreds out of their homes
text: parts of the city were flooded last month after the foss barrier was raised amid fears the adjoining pumping station could be overwhelmed by water .
hundreds of people were evacuated and some living near the river foss were trapped in their homes .
residents described the water surging through the city as a `` nightmare '' and dozens of businesses were left counting the cost of ruined stock and forced closures .

documents.title: good evening
text: hello and welcome to our special live page covering the floods public meeting in york tonight .
plenty of questions will be asked of the city 's leaders at the barbican when the meting starts at 18:00 about how and why so many homes and businesses flooded over christmas .
we 'll be with you until around 20:00 when the meeting is due to end .
author: Lauren Potts
BBC Local Live
